Package Components

Class Controller<I,O>

java.lang.Object
Components.Controller<I,O>
Type Parameters:
I - Type of input data for the function.
O - Type of output data for the function.
All Implemented Interfaces:
MetricsObserver
public class Controller<I,O> extends Object implements MetricsObserver
Class implementing a controller for a Function-as-a-Service (FaaS) system. Allows registration, invocation, and management of functions through invokers.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()
      Default constructor for the Components.Controller class. Initializes the necessary lists, maps, policy manager and creates a default invoker.

    • Controller

      public Controller(int invokerCount)
      Constructor with invoker count for the Components.Controller class. Initializes the necessary lists, maps, policy manager and creates invokers according to the specified count.
      Parameters:
      invokerCount - Number of invokers to be created.

    • Controller

      public Controller(int invokerCount, int invokerCount2, int ram, int ram2)
      Constructor for the Components.Controller class. Initializes the necessary lists, maps, policy manager and creates invokers according to the specified count and RAM.
      Parameters:
      invokerCount - Number of invokers to be created.
      invokerCount2 - Number of invokers2 to be created.
      ram - Amount of RAM associated with each invoker.
      ram2 - Amount of RAM associated with each invoker2.

  • Method Details

    • addInvoker

      public void addInvoker(int numThreads, int ram)
      Adds a new invoker to the list of invokers from the controller with the specified number of threads and RAM.
      Parameters:
      numThreads - Number of threads for the new invoker.
      ram - RAM configuration for the new invoker.

    • registerAction

      public void registerAction(String name, Function<I,O> function)
      Method to register a new function. It checks if the function is already registered.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function.
      function - Implementation of the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is already registered.

    • registerAction

      public void registerAction(String name, Function<I,O> function, int ram)
      Method to register a new function with a specific amount of RAM. It checks if the function is already registered.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function.
      function - Implementation of the function.
      ram - Amount of RAM associated with the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is already registered or the RAM is less than 0.

    • invoke

      public Object invoke(String name, I input)
      Invokes a function with a single input synchronously to an invoker.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function to invoke.
      input - Input to the function.
      Returns:
      Output of the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is not found.
      IllegalStateException - If there is not enough available memory in any of the invokers.

    • invokeWithInvoker

      public Object invokeWithInvoker(String name, I input, Invoker<I,O> invoker)
      Invokes a function with a single input synchronously to an invoker.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function to invoke.
      input - Input to the function.
      invoker - Invoker to invoke the function.
      Returns:
      Output of the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is not found.

    • invoke

      public List<Object> invoke(String name, List<I> inputList)
      Invokes a function with a list of inputs synchronously to an invoker.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function to invoke.
      inputList - List of inputs to the function.
      Returns:
      List of outputs of the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is not found.
      IllegalStateException - If there is not enough available memory in any of the invokers.

    • invokeAsync

      public Future<O> invokeAsync(String name, I input)
      Invokes a function with a single input asynchronously to an invoker.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function to invoke.
      input - Input to the function.
      Returns:
      Future representing the output of the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is not found.
      IllegalStateException - If there is not enough available memory in any of the invokers.

    • invokeAsyncWithInvoker

      public Future<O> invokeAsyncWithInvoker(String name, I input, Invoker<I,O> invoker)
      Invokes a function with a single input asynchronously to an invoker.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function to invoke.
      input - Input to the function.
      invoker - Invoker to invoke the function.
      Returns:
      Future representing the output of the function.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is not found.

    • invokeAsync

      public List<Future<O>> invokeAsync(String name, List<I> inputList)
      Invokes a function with a list of inputs asynchronously to an invoker.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the function to invoke.
      inputList - List of inputs to the function.
      Returns:
      List of Futures representing the outputs of the function for each input.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the specified function is not found.
      IllegalStateException - If there is not enough available memory in any of the invokers.

      Method to use the policy manager to assign functions to invokers.
      Parameters:
      policy - Policy to be used by the policy manager.
      functionsToAssign - List of functions to assign.
      Returns:
      List of invokers with assigned functions.
